Content: The value of a luxury ressources should be a logistical function f(x),
where x is a logarithm (since the logistical functions domain is
negative infinity to positive infinity) of a ratio between consumers
and total investement in that category. This functions minimal has to
be greater than zero, so there is always a profit to be made,
especially at low investment. (Where the ressource is very rare.) This
offset/function minimal should be differen for different luxury
ressources, so novels can be half as valuable as exotic dancers.
